comments.body: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/67207. Now that we not use the default values, we should modify it
this is fixed now, I don't know why the values are set like that but backwards-compat preserved now
This is configuration specific to the controller, naming it like this is super confusing.

I agree that apiserver is an odd place for leader election config to go (same point made in https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/2354#discussion_r202031081).

I can buy that it doesn't really belong under apimachinery either... it's a little higher level than that.

The leader election utilities are under k8s.io/client-go/tools/leaderelection - would it make sense for leader election config to go under client-go somewhere? (I think that decision can happen in parallel with this PR, but should be settled before we ship this)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@			KubeAPIBurst:            30,
			ControllerStartInterval: metav1.Duration{Duration: 0},
			LeaderElection: apiserverconfig.LeaderElectionConfiguration{
				ResourceLock:  "endpoints",
				LeaderElect:   true,

comments.body:
Which of the field in `GenericControllerManagerOptions` are actually used in kube- **and** cloud-controller-manager. In other words, `GenericControllerManagerOptions` does not really look generic.

If we could get rid of the `GenericControllerManagerOptions` layer now, we would also get rid of the strange `Generic.GenericComponent`.
